meanings.definition: of or relating to the dawn or the east
meanings.sent1: The auroral light of the morning sky signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent2: The auroral glow on the horizon indicated that sunrise was approaching.
meanings.sent3: The early bird enjoyed the auroral hues of the sunrise while others were still asleep.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and warm as an auroral sunrise.
meanings.sent5: The auroral colors painted across the sky made the landscape look magical.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the aurora borealis
meanings.sent1: We were lucky to witness the auroral display in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The auroral lights danced gracefully above us, mesmerizing everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the auroral lights were playful laser beams to chase.
meanings.sent4: The auroral glow enveloped the sky like a mystical curtain.
meanings.sent5: The auroral spectacle left us in awe of nature's beauty.

meanings.definition: resembling the aurora borealis in brightness or color
meanings.sent1: Her dress shimmered with an auroral sheen under the lights.
meanings.sent2: The painting captured the auroral essence with its vibrant colors.
meanings.sent3: The cake frosting sparkled with an auroral glow, making it look magical.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky in an auroral display of colors.
meanings.sent5: The gemstone's iridescence was auroral, reflecting a rainbow of hues.
